definition: the semantic role of the animate entity that instigates or causes the happening denoted by the verb in the clause
opposite_reasoning: NaturalAgent is the strongest opposite for ArtificialAgent along the most relevant dimension: the artificial/natural distinction in agents. This opposition is: (1) Semantically clean - mutually exclusive and exhaustive within the agent domain, (2) Ontologically fundamental in SUMO taxonomies, (3) Highly relevant for AI safety - distinguishing artificial from biological/human agency is critical for alignment monitoring and deception detection, (4) Creates a maximally discriminative Fisher-LDA axis for separating artificial AI behaviors from natural human behaviors. While Patient offers good semantic role opposition, NaturalAgent better preserves the entity-level contrast while maintaining the agentive properties that make this concept important for AI safety applications.
